# SOLUTION
t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    n, k = map(int, input().split())
    a = list(map(int, input().split()))
    b = list(map(int, input().split()))
    a.sort()
    b.sort(reverse=True)
    for i in range(n):
        if k == 0:
            break
        if a[i] < b[i]:
            a[i], b[i] = b[i], a[i]
            k -= 1
    print(sum(a))

# SOLUTION
t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    n, k = map(int, input().split())
    a = list(map(int, input().split()))
    b = list(map(int, input().split()))
    a.sort()
    b.sort()
    s = sum(a)
    for i in range(n):
        if k > 0:
            if a[i] < b[n - i - 1]:
                k -= 1
                s -= a[i]
                s += b[n - i - 1]
    print(s)

# SOLUTION
t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    n, k = map(int, input().split())
    a = list(map(int, input().split()))
    b = list(map(int, input().split()))
    a.sort()
    b.sort()
    if k > n:
        k = n
    for i in range(k):
        if a[i] < b[n-i-1]:
            a[i], b[n-i-1] = b[n-i-1], a[i]
    print(sum(a))

# SOLUTION
# The idea is to sort both arrays in descending order.
# Then, we iterate from left to right, and compare the values at each index.
# If the value in array a is smaller than the value in array b, we swap them.
# We keep track of the number of swaps we have done.
# If we have done more than k swaps, we return the sum of array a.
# Else, we return the sum of array b.

t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    n, k = map(int, input().split())
    a = list(map(int, input().split()))
    b = list(map(int, input().split()))
    a.sort(reverse=True)
    b.sort(reverse=True)
    num_swaps = 0
    for i in range(n):
        if a[i] < b[i]:
            a[i], b[i] = b[i], a[i]
            num_swaps += 1
        if num_swaps > k:
            break
    if num_swaps > k:
        print(sum(a))
    else:
        print(sum(b))
